verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: When King Hezekiah heard the report, he tore his clothes in grief, put on rough sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he sent Eliakim, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.
verses.ct: He sent Eliakim, the palace administrator, along with Shebna the secretary and the senior priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and blasphemy; for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.
verses.ct: They told him, "Hezekiah says this: Today is a day of distress, punishment, and disgrace. We are like a woman ready to deliver a baby but without the strength to push it out."

verses.kjv: It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.
verses.ct: "Perhaps the LORD your God has heard everything the Rabshakeh said — the one the king of Assyria sent to insult the living God — and will punish him for those words. So please pray for the survivors who are still left."

verses.kjv: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
verses.ct: So King Hezekiah's officials went to Isaiah.

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say to your master, Thus saith the LORD, Be not afraid of the words which thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
verses.ct: Isaiah told them, "Tell your master this — the LORD says: Don't be afraid of the words you heard, the ones the Assyrian king's servants used to mock me."

verses.kjv: Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and shall return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
verses.ct: "Look, I am going to put a spirit in him so that when he hears a certain report, he will go back to his own country. And I will have him killed by the sword in his own land."

verses.kjv: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.
verses.ct: The Rabshakeh left and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, since he had heard that the king had moved on from Lachish.

verses.kjv: And when he heard say of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, Behold, he is come out to fight against thee: he sent messengers again unto Hezekiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then Sennacherib received a report that King Tirhakah of Ethiopia was marching out to fight against him. So he sent messengers to Hezekiah again with this message:

verses.kjv: Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God in whom thou trustest deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
verses.ct: "Say this to King Hezekiah of Judah: Don't let the God you trust in fool you by promising that Jerusalem won't be handed over to the king of Assyria."

verses.kjv: Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly: and shalt thou be delivered?
verses.ct: "You've certainly heard what the kings of Assyria have done to every other nation — completely destroying them. Do you really think you'll be rescued?"

verses.kjv: Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed; as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Thelasar?
verses.ct: "Did the gods of those nations save them — the nations my predecessors destroyed: Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden who lived in Thelasar?"

verses.kjv: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivah?
verses.ct: "What happened to the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of the city of Sepharvaim, and the kings of Hena and Ivah?"

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up into the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.
verses.ct: Hezekiah took the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the house of the LORD and laid it open in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah prayed before the LORD, and said, O LORD God of Israel, which dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; thou hast made heaven and earth.
verses.ct: Hezekiah prayed in the LORD's presence, saying, "LORD God of Israel, you who sit enthroned above the cherubim — you alone are God over every kingdom on earth. You made heaven and earth."

verses.kjv: LORD, bow down thine ear, and hear: open, LORD, thine eyes, and see: and hear the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent him to reproach the living God.
verses.ct: "LORD, pay attention and listen. Open your eyes, LORD, and see. Hear the words Sennacherib has sent to insult the living God."

verses.kjv: Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have destroyed the nations and their lands,
verses.ct: "It's true, LORD — the kings of Assyria have devastated the nations and their lands."

verses.kjv: And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men’s hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.
verses.ct: "They have thrown their gods into the fire. But those weren't real gods — they were just things made by human hands, wood and stone. That's why they could destroy them."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, O LORD our God, I beseech thee, save thou us out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the LORD God, even thou only.
verses.ct: "So now, LORD our God, I beg you — rescue us from his power, so that every kingdom on earth will know that you, LORD, are God — you alone."

verses.kjv: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, That which thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.
verses.ct: Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah: "The LORD God of Israel says: I have heard your prayer to me about King Sennacherib of Assyria."

verses.kjv: This is the word that the LORD hath spoken concerning him; The virgin the daughter of Zion hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD has declared about him: The young woman, the daughter of Zion, looks down on you and mocks you. The daughter of Jerusalem shakes her head as you retreat."

verses.kjv: Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: "Who have you insulted and mocked? Against whom have you raised your voice and looked with arrogance? Against the Holy One of Israel!"

verses.kjv: By thy messengers thou hast reproached the LORD, and hast said, With the multitude of my chariots I am come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon, and will cut down the tall cedar trees thereof, and the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the lodgings of his borders, and into the forest of his Carmel.
verses.ct: "Through your messengers you have taunted the Lord, boasting, 'With my massive army of chariots I have climbed the highest mountains, the remote peaks of Lebanon. I have cut down its tallest cedars and its finest cypress trees. I have reached its farthest lodges and its densest forests.'"

verses.kjv: I have digged and drunk strange waters, and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of besieged places.
verses.ct: "'I have dug wells and drunk foreign waters. With the soles of my feet I have dried up all the rivers of Egypt.'"

verses.kjv: Hast thou not heard long ago how I have done it, and of ancient times that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste fenced cities into ruinous heaps.
verses.ct: "Haven't you heard? Long ago I planned this. In ancient times I designed it. Now I have brought it about — that you would crush fortified cities into piles of rubble."

verses.kjv: Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded; they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the house tops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up.
verses.ct: "Their people had no power to resist. They were terrified and humiliated. They were like grass in a field, like tender green plants, like grass sprouting on a rooftop — scorched before it can even grow."

verses.kjv: But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.
verses.ct: "But I know where you live, when you go out, when you come in, and how you rage against me."

verses.kjv: Because thy rage against me and thy tumult is come up into mine ears, therefore I will put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.
verses.ct: "Because your fury against me and your arrogance have reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will drag you back the same way you came."

verses.kjv: And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such things as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruits thereof.
verses.ct: "And this will be the sign for you, Hezekiah: This year you will eat whatever grows on its own. The 2nd year you will eat what springs up from that. But in the 3rd year, plant and harvest crops, plant vineyards, and eat their fruit."

verses.kjv: And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall yet again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.
verses.ct: "The surviving remnant of the house of Judah will once again take root below and produce fruit above."

verses.kjv: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the LORD of hosts shall do this.
verses.ct: "Because a remnant will go out from Jerusalem, and survivors will come from Mount Zion. The passionate commitment of the LORD of hosts will accomplish this."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield, nor cast a bank against it.
verses.ct: "Therefore, the LORD says this about the king of Assyria: He will not enter this city. He will not shoot a single arrow here. He will not approach it with shields or build a siege ramp against it."

verses.kjv: By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "He will go back the same way he came. He will not enter this city, declares the LORD."

verses.kjv: For I will defend this city, to save it, for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.
verses.ct: "I will protect this city and rescue it — for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the LORD went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.
verses.ct: That very night, the angel of the LORD went out and struck down 185,000 soldiers in the Assyrian camp. When the survivors got up early the next morning, they found dead bodies everywhere.

verses.kjv: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.
verses.ct: So King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp, withdrew, and went back to live in Nineveh.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword: and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: One day, while he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer killed him with swords and then escaped to the land of Armenia. His son Esarhaddon became king in his place.
